entry.title: New paper “Ogre: A Python package for molecular crystal surface generation with applications to surface energy and crystal habit prediction” is published and selected as JCP Emerging Investigators Special Collection

link.title: New paper "Ogre: A Python package for molecular crystal surface generation with applications to surface energy and crystal habit prediction" is published and selected as JCP Emerging Investigators Special Collection

entry.content:
I’m very glad to announce that our paper Ogre is published online and selected to become a part of JCP Emerging Investigators Special Collection. This paper partially represent the efforts we have made on surface generatons. We want to write a tool to cleave slabs and predict the optimized structure of interfaces. And this paper contains the first step. In this paper, we present Ogre, an open-source code for generating molecular crystal surface slabs based on graphic molecular representations. Moreover, we utilize Ogre to carry out quantum-chemistry calculation and crystal habit prediction.

In the subsequent research, we will use Ogre to cleave slabs and predict optimized interfaces of two slabs via Monte-Carlo Methods and machine learning.

Reference:

Ogre: A Python package for molecular crystal surface generation with applications to surface energy and crystal habit prediction
Shuyang Yang, Imanuel Bier, Wen Wen, Jiawei Zhan, Saeed Moayedpour, and Noa Marom
J. Chem. Phys. 152, 244122 (2020) / AIP / Project Page

entry.title: Our new paper “Potassium-Doped g-C3N4 Achieving Efficient Visible-Light-Driven CO2 Reduction” is published on ACS Sustainable Chem. Eng.

link.title: Our new paper "Potassium-Doped g-C3N4 Achieving Efficient Visible-Light-Driven CO2 Reduction" is published on ACS Sustainable Chem. Eng.

entry.content:
I’m very happy to anounce that our paper is finally published after one year of theoretical computations and experiments. In this paper, we report a new study on the potassium-doped g-C3N4 (K-CN) being used for CO2 reduction irradiated by visible light. And Our work further validates the importance of inhibiting e–/h+ recombination in improving solar energy conversion efficiency while also bringing hope for efficient solar fuel production using g-C3N4.

Reference:

Potassium-Doped g-C3N4 Achieving Efficient Visible-Light-Driven CO2 Reduction
Shuhui Wang, Jiawei Zhan, Kui Chen, Asad Ali, Linghui Zeng, He Zhao, Wanglai Hu*, Lixin Zhu*, and Xiaoliang Xu*
ACS Sustainable Chem. Eng. 2020, 8, 22, 8214–8222 / ACS Publication
